snippet: Two-thirds of Germany’s gold reserves is stored in Paris, London and New York. The German central bank, responding to a public outcry over accountability, is going to repatriate some of the gold.
abstract: Two-thirds of Germany’s gold reserves is stored in Paris, London and New York, with nearly half in New York; German central bank, responding to public outcry over accountability, is set to repatriate 300 tons; goal is to house more than 50 percent of German gold in Bundesbank vaults by 2020.
lead_paragraph: Two-thirds of Germany’s gold reserves is stored in Paris, London and New York. The German central bank, responding to a public outcry over accountability, is going to repatriate some of the gold.

headline.seo: Bundesbank to Repatriate Some Overseas Gold Reserves
headline.main: Germany to Move 674 Tons of Gold
headline.print_headline: Germany Will Cart Home Some of Its Buried Treasure
